conclusion: The electromotive force of the power supply is E=6V, the internal resistance is r=2Ω, the fixed resistors are R1=2Ω, R2=3Ω, R3=6Ω, and the capacitance of the capacitor is C=10μF.
After closing switch S, the circuit stabilizes.
The resistors R2 and R3 are in series, so their total resistance is R23 = R2 + R3 = 3Ω + 6Ω = 9Ω.
The resistor R1 is in parallel with the series combination R23. The total resistance R_total is given by 1/R_total = 1/R1 + 1/R23 = 1/2Ω + 1/9Ω = 9/18Ω + 2/18Ω = 11/18Ω.
The total resistance of the circuit is R_total + r = 18/11Ω + 2Ω = 18/11 + 22/11 = 40/11Ω.
The total current I is given by Ohm's law: I = E/(R_total + r) = 6V/(40/11Ω) = 6V/(62/11Ω) = 6 * 11/62A = 66/62A = 33/31A.
The voltage drop across R23 is V23 = I * R23 = 33/31A * 9Ω = 297/31V.

The voltage across the capacitor is the difference between the voltage of the power supply and the voltage drop across R1: VC = E - I * R1 = 6V - 33/31A * 2Ω = 6V - 66/31V = 186/31V - 66/31V = 120/31V.
